name: From Aim to Zane Online Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: What word--beginning with A and ending with the AIM or AIN sound--means kudos, praise, or recognition?
questions.explanation:
acclaim.

	Other A words ending with these sounds include aim, abstain, and ascertain. Antonyms for acclaim include censure and condemnation.

questions.text: What word--beginning with B and ending with the AIM or AIN sound [not spelling]--means "accuse"?
questions.explanation:
blame.

	Other B words ending with the AIN sound include bane, brain, bloodstain, and blain (which means "a swelling," as in chilblain). Antonyms for the verb to blame include praise and endorse.

questions.text: What word--beginning with C and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--is the past-tense of come?
questions.explanation:
came.

	The word chamberlain seems like it would end with the AIN sound, but it ends with the EN or IN sound. Its last syllable could rhyme with Ben or sound like Lynn. One antonym for came is went.

questions.text: What word--beginning with D and ending with the AIM or AIN sound [not spelling]--means "denigrate, besmirch, or vilify"?
questions.explanation:
defame.

	Other D words ending with these sounds include dame, Dane, disdain, or detain. Antonyms for the verb to defame include laud and celebrate.

questions.text: What word--beginning with E and ending with the AIM or AIN sound--means "to blurt, declare, or call out"?
questions.explanation:
exclaim.

	Other E words ending with these sounds include entrain, endgame, entertain, and eyestrain. Antonyms for exclaim include conceal or hush up.

questions.text: What word--beginning with F and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means to pretend or dissemble?
questions.explanation:
feign.

	Other F words ending with these sounds include fain, fame, flame, and filename. Antonyms for "to feign" include "to be honest" or "to act completely openly and sincerely."

questions.text: What word--beginning with G and ending with the AIM or AIN sound--fits this clue: A _______ of rice or sand?
questions.explanation:
grain.

	Other G words ending with these sounds include gain, game, and grosgrain. Grain alcohol, or corn liquor, is a clear liquid distilled at a high ethyl alcohol content.

questions.text: What word--beginning with H and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means benevolent, merciful, or altruistic?
questions.explanation:
humane.

	Other H words ending with this sound include hydroplane, hurricane, and henbane. Antonyms for humane include cruel, inhuman, and amoral.

questions.text: What word--beginning with I and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means absurd, fatuous, or illogical?
questions.explanation:
inane.

	Other I words ending with this sound include insane, inhumane, and ingrain. Antonyms for inane include wise, reasonable, and appropriate.

questions.text: What word--beginning with J and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--fit this clue: _______ Austen or plain _______?
questions.explanation:
Jane.

	Other famous Janes include Jane Doe, Jane Eyre, Jane Seymour (third wife of Henry VIII) and Jane of the "Dick and Jane" U.S. elementary school readers of the 1950s.

questions.text: What word--beginning with K and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--fits this clue: Citizen _______?
questions.explanation:
Kane.

	Orson Welles produced, co-authored, directed, and starred in this 1941 film. The movie tells the life story of Charles Foster Kane, a fictional character based upon William Randolph Hearst. "Rosebud!"

questions.text: What word--beginning with L and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means unable to walk very well?
questions.explanation:
lame.

	L words ending with the AIN sound include lain, lane, and lamebrain. Antonyms for lame include fit, muscular, and sound.

questions.text: What word--beginning with M and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means to disfigure, mangle, or mutilate?
questions.explanation:
maim.

	M words ending with the AIN sound include main, mane, multigrain, and murrain. The word mountain seems like it would end with this sound, but of course it doesn't. Antonyms for maim include heal and restore.

questions.text: What word--beginning with N and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means moniker?
questions.explanation:
name.

	Other N words ending with the AIM sound include nickname. Are there any antonyms for name? I don't really think so.

questions.text: What word--beginning with O and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--fits this clue: High-_______ gasoline?
questions.explanation:
octane.

	Other O words ending with the AIN sound include obtain, outgain, and overexplain. An octane is one of 18 isomeric saturated hydrocarbons, some of which are obtained in the distillation and cracking of petroleum.

questions.text: What word--beginning with P and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means to predetermine or predestine?
questions.explanation:
preordain.

	Other P words ending with the AIN sound include pain, pertain, and plantain. Antonyms for to preordain include "to select at random."

questions.text: What word--beginning with Q and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means to give up one's claim to real estate?
questions.explanation:
quitclaim.

	Quatrain is the only Q word I could come up with that ends with the AIN sound. One antonym for quitclaim might be "to legally purchase real estate."

questions.text: What word--beginning with R and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means to rule, command, or dominate?
questions.explanation:
reign.

	Other R words ending with these sounds include rain, rein, restrain, refrain, rattlebrain, and reclaim. One antonym for reign might be "to subject oneself to command or servitude" or "to humble oneself or act slavishly."

questions.text: What word--beginning with S and ending with AIM or AIN--fits this clue: A _______ on someone's character?
questions.explanation:
stain.

	Other S words ending with these sounds include sane, same, sustain, strain, swain, sugarcane, seaplane, surname, and selfsame. Synonyms for the verb to stain include "to bleach."

questions.text: What word--beginning with T and ending with AIM or AIN--means landscape, turf, or topography?
questions.explanation:
terrain.

	Other T words ending with these sounds include tame, train, and twain. Kinds of terrain include mountainous and flat.

questions.text: What word--beginning with U and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means cosmopolitan, sophisticated, or debonair?
questions.explanation:
urbane.

	Urethane and unchain are other U words that end with the AIN sound. Antonyms for urbane include unsophisticated and jejune.

questions.text: What word--beginning with V and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means "an herb that is also known as verbena"?
questions.explanation:
vervain.

	The vervain plant, sometimes called verbena, flowers annually. It grows in Europe, North America, and South America. This plant is an herbal remedy that people used in ancient Roman times. Believers in herbal medicine still use it (in tea form) to detoxify the body, cleanse the colon, and even to treat psychological disorders.

questions.text: What word--beginning with W and ending with the AIM or AIN SOUND--means "a poisonous flowering plant, also known as monkshood"?
questions.explanation:
wolfsbane.

	In the 1931 movie "Dracula," Van Helsing instructs the nurse charged with protecting Mina from Count Dracula to protect Mina by placing sprigs of wolfbane around her neck.

questions.text: I'm skipping X and Y. What word begins with Z, ends with the AIN or AIM SOUND, and means "a protein from corn that lacks lysine and tryptophan and is used especially in making textile fibers, plastics, printing inks, coatings, and adhesives and sizes"?
questions.explanation:
zein.

	There is also Zane Grey, who was an American author (and dentist!) acclaimed for his popular adventure novels set in the American West. Grey idealized the American frontier, which wasn't really as chock-a-block with heroes as he made it out to be.

questions.text: Back to A. What word begins with A, ends with the AIN or AIM SOUND, and means "to point in the correct direction"?
questions.explanation:
aim.

	Ready, aim, fire! Zane Grey's heroes all possessed perfect aim. One synonym for "to aim" might be "to fire at random or haphazardly."
